oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oxytetracycline Residues in Milk After Intrauterine Infusion of Dairy Cows With Retained Fetal Membranes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dinsmore, R. P.
Stevens, R. D.
Cattell, M. B.
Salman, M. D.
Sundlof, S. F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: milk residue
retained fetal membranes
oxytetracycline
duration
liquid chromatography
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Our objectives were to establish the duration, by high performance liquid chromatography, of milk residues of oxytetracycline (OTC) after intrauterine infusion of 5 g OT of cows with retained fetal membranes. We also determined the predictive values positive (PVPT) and negative (PVNT) of the Delvo-P (Gist Brocades), Cite Probe (ldexx), Charm Farm, and Charm II (Charm Sciences) tests for OT residues above 30 ppb, and above the stated minimum detection level of each test. Cows with mastitis were not included. Milk samples were collected from 50 cows at 24 hour intervals during treatment, and at 12 hour intervals after the cessation of treatment. The results of this work plus important implications for dairy practitioners will be discussed in this presentation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1993; 186-187
